title: Encephalitis: 'Friendly fire' in my brain saw me sectioned in error
description: Model Lucy Dawson was 21 when a life-threatening illness was misdiagnosed as a mental breakdown.

title: Rose moves into Masters lead on day one
description: England's Justin Rose hits a seven-under 65 to open a four-stroke lead on the opening day of the Masters as Rory McIlroy and Lee Westwood struggle.

title: Brixton riots: Has enough changed in 40 years?
description: Some of those at the heart of the 1981 Brixton riots reflect on the past four decades.

title: What will self-driving trucks mean for truck drivers?
description: Trucking is a big employer but autonomous trucks are on the horizon - are they a threat?

title: Lockdown easing: What to watch for when you’re out and about
description: The BBC’s David Shukman on how to navigate lockdown easing while keeping yourself and others safe.

title: Is Netflix's Seaspiracy film right about fishing damaging oceans?
description: Are the activities of the fishing industry destroying the world's oceans as a new film suggests?

title: Bird Photographer of the Year 2021 finalists revealed
description: Brawling puffins, warbling warblers and swooping swallows - some of this year's shortlisted images.

title: Covid-19: Why have deaths soared in Brazil?
description: President Bolsonaro has downplayed the pandemic and resisted lockdowns but now faces a major crisis.

title: Eating disorders: 'My BMI wasn't low enough to get help'
description: Using the Body Mass Index to measure health inspires stigma and should be scrapped, MPs say.

title: Artist Tracey Emin says her cancer is 'gone'
description: The 57-year-old was diagnosed with a "really rapid, really aggressive" bladder cancer last year.

title: Glass Animals: How Heat Waves became the ultimate sleeper hit
description: From severe injuries to Hollywood A-listers - here's the unlikely story of the ultimate sleeper hit.

title: Ribblehead viaduct: Major restoration scheme completed
description: Engineers have worked on the £2.1m project at the Ribblehead viaduct throughout the winter months.

title: Richard Okorogheye: Mother does not believe son took his own life
description: Richard Okorogheye's mother, Evidence Joel, says she does not believe her son took his own life.

title: Grand National 2021: Cloth Cap heads Aintree field as The Storyteller is withdrawn
description: The Storyteller is the only withdrawal as the final field of 40 horses is named for Saturday's Aintree Grand National.

title: Captain Hunter back to lead England in Six Nations
description: After a long-term nerve injury and 13 months away from international duty, Sarah Hunter is finally fit and ready to captain England in the Six Nations.

title: Netflix series prompts fan to restore first paid footballer's grave
description: Jacqueline McAleese was moved by Fergus Suter's story on Netflix series, The English Game.

title: Who takes captaincy? And who plays in goal? Key questions for Lionesses before friendlies
description: As England prepare to take on France and Canada, there are questions still to be answered before the Team GB squad is announced.

title: Caroline Jurie: Mrs World arrested over Sri Lanka pageant bust-up
description: The beauty queen and another contestant are arrested after a fracas at the Mrs Sri Lanka pageant.

title: Myanmar's ex-UK envoy says military attaché has 'occupied' embassy
description: Kyaw Zwar Minn spends the night in his car after saying the military attaché "occupied" the embassy.

title: Belfast: Rioting 'was worst seen in Northern Ireland in years'
description: Police were attacked and petrol bombs thrown in the latest disorder close to a Belfast peaceline.

title: Buckingham Palace to open garden for summer picnics
description: The "walled oasis in the middle of London" boasts 30 species of breeding birds and over 1,000 trees.

title: What is behind the violence in Northern Ireland?
description: Brexit, paramilitaries and the fallout from an IRA man's funeral lie behind rising loyalist tension.

title: Covid: More than enough vaccines for under-30s, says Hancock
description: The health secretary says the vaccine rollout remains on track to jab all adults by the end of July.

title: Covid-19 vaccine booking opens to 40-44-year-olds in NI
description: People in that age group are able to book an appointment for a jab from midday on Thursday.

title: Czech Republic vaccines: European court backs mandatory pre-school jabs
description: Families had challenged the Czech government's ban on unvaccinated children entering pre-schools.

title: Peter Ainsworth: Boris Johnson leads tributes after death of former Tory MP
description: Peter Ainsworth - former shadow environment secretary and MP for East Surrey - has died aged 64.

title: Richard Okorogheye death: Met referred to police watchdog
description: Richard Okorogheye's body was found in a pond in Epping Forest, two weeks after he went missing.

title: Captain Hunter back for England against Italy
description: England captain Sarah Hunter will return for the first time in 13 months as head coach Simon Middleton makes sweeping changes for Saturday's Women's Six Nations match in Italy.

title: London knife deaths: Mums tell of hardest calls after sons stabbed
description: Commissioner Dame Cressida Dick hopes the 'tragic accounts' will persuade people to call Crimestoppers.

title: Jane McDonald announces death of fiancé Eddie Rothe at 67
description: Rothe was best known for being a drummer in the band Liquid Gold and later The Searchers.

title: Women could be owed 'lottery-winning' pension sums
description: Up to 5,000 female pensioners could be entitled to huge refunds under a little-known-rule, the BBC has learned.

title: Women with disabilities 'groped and not taken seriously'
description: Women with disabilities are twice as likely to experience sexual assault as non-disabled, figures show.

title: French Open postponed by one week in hope more fans can attend
description: The French Open will now run from 30 May to 13 June in the hope that more spectators will be permitted to attend.

title: Wiltshire pub's new chalet 'breaks Covid rules'
description: The bar, with pizza oven and TV, does not comply with outdoor shelter guidelines, a council says.

title: How Granada have risen with an in-demand boss & a Spurs flop
description: Less than two years after relegation, Granada are preparing to face Manchester United in a Europa League quarter-final - how did they do it?

title: The Papers: Family of clot victim speaks as experts urge jab
description: The latest on the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine makes the front pages of most of Thursday's papers.
